SENT.plain: Injury to the anterior choroidal artery (AchA) can be devastating owing to the importance of the territory it supplies
The AchA is a known site of aneurysm formation, and is often exposed during various surgical and endovascular procedures

We report a patient with an aneurysm at the origin of the AchA, and an anomalous medial take off of the artery from the internal carotid artery, then a sharp lateral turn followed by a normal course toward the choroidal fissure, unreported to date to our knowledge
The aneurysm was treated successfully by endovascular therapy
The typical anatomy of the AchA, and reported variations in its origin are discussed
Thorough knowledge of the normal cerebrovascular anatomy and attention to variations play an important role in the successful management of patients with neurological vascular conditions
